name: interdental
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
between the teeth or for use between the teeth: interdental spacesinterdental brush Keep your teeth clean by using interdental brushes in addition to your usual toothbrushing.
phonetics
  specialized used to describe a sound that is made by putting the end of the tongue between the upper and lower front teeth: The interdental [T] is non-existent in Catalan phonetics.interdental fricative Many foreign learners have difficulty in pronouncing interdental fricatives (as in thin, this).
More examplesFewer examplesClean between your teeth once a day with floss or interdental cleaners.Your dentist will also recommend dental floss and perhaps interdental brushes.The toothpick can be worked into some of the tightest interdental spaces to attack plaque.In British English initial interdental fricatives are frequently pronounced as their corresponding stops.The word is adapted via the substitution of the alveolar sibilant 0 s 0 for the interdental consontant 0T0.

  specialized a sound that is made by putting the end of the tongue between the upper and lower front teeth: Interdentals can be transcribed in different ways.
